Detailed Description

Implements a camera and stores its parameter.

The camera is defined by its position, focus point, clipping plane and some other parameters.

Definition at line 8 of file Camera.hpp.

void Camera::CompleteCamera (    ) 
 

Definition at line 27 of file Camera.cpp.

References EPSILON, eyep, fov, hfov, hres, lookp, M_PI, Vector::Norm(), Vector::Normalize(), pixh, pixv, tanFovH, tanFovV, updir, vfov, viewdist, vres, X, Y, and Z.

Referenced by Camera(), and Scene::Read(). 

00028 {
00029         // set up Z
00030         Z=lookp - eyep;
00031 
00032         // distance from virtual camera position to focus point
00033         viewdist = Z.Norm ();
00034         if (viewdist < EPSILON) {
00035                 printf("Camera error: eyepoint and look-point coincide\n");
00036                 return;
00037         }
00038         Z *= 1.0f / viewdist;
00039         
00040         // set up X   Camera->X is a direction pointing to the right in the window 
00041         X = Z && updir;         //crossproduct
00042 
00043         float lengthX = X.Norm ();
00044         if (lengthX < EPSILON) {
00045                 printf("Camera error: up-direction and viewing direction coincide\n");
00046                 return;
00047         }
00048         X *= 1.0f / lengthX;
00049         
00050         // set up Y
00051         Y = Z && X;             // CrossProduct 
00052         Y.Normalize ();
00053         
00054         // compute horizontal and vertical field of view angle from the specified one
00055         // if the vertical resolution is smaller, it is the specified fov = 45, the other is greater than 45
00056         if (hres < vres) {
00057                 hfov = fov; 
00058                 vfov = atanf(tanf(fov * M_PI/180.0f) * (float)vres/(float)hres) * 180.0f/M_PI;
00059         } else {
00060                 vfov = fov; 
00061                 hfov = atanf(tanf(fov * M_PI/180.0f) * (float)hres/(float)vres) * 180.0f/M_PI;
00062         }
00063         
00064         /* Compute some extra frequently used quantities */
00065         tanFovH = tanf(hfov * M_PI / 180.0f);
00066         tanFovV = tanf(vfov * M_PI / 180.0f);
00067         pixh = 2.0f * tanFovH / (float)(hres);
00068         pixv = 2.0f * tanFovV / (float)(vres);
00069 
00070 }
